description:
The Embassy of Canada to Saudi Arabia, in Riyadh requires the existing water storage tanks to be replaced in 7 of the staff quarters. The staff quarters were constructed in the 1980s and the water tanks are the original tanks installed at the time of construction. The staff quarters are detached and semi-detached type properties, consisting of a ground, first and second floors. \-r
\-r



The main water storage tanks are located on the roof of the properties. The existing storage tanks are a fibreglass lined plastic tanks housed within a concrete structure. The fibreglass lining is delaminating and there are signs of leaks. \-r
\-r



It is recommended that the Bidder or a representative of the Bidder visit the work site. Arrangements have been made for the site visit to be held at the Embassy of Canada, Diplomatic Quarter, Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, on November 24 and 25, 2024. The site visits will begin at 10:00 AM (Arabia Standard Time).\rn\rn\n
The intended outcome of the tender is for the supply of materials and labor for the replacement of water storage tanks. The anticipated start date for the contract is January 1 2025 and the end date is December 31 2025. Also, the bid closing date is December 10 2024. Additionally, the bid submission is in a language other than English.

**Contact Information - Informations de contact:**

Eric Rainville  
(343) 572-7269  
realproperty-contracts@international.gc.ca

### Brief Tender Overview

The Embassy of Canada to Saudi Arabia, in Riyadh, is seeking bids for the replacement of the existing water storage tanks in 7 staff quarters. The water tanks are in need of replacement due to their age (installed in the 1980s) and signs of water leaks.

A bidders’ conference has been scheduled virtually on 2 December 2024 to review the scope of the requirement and answer questions. Attendance by bidders is highly recommended. Site visits are also encouraged on 24-25 November 2024 at the Embassy of Canada, Diplomatic Quarter.

### Tender Details

*   Water storage tanks are to be replaced with new tanks.
*   The site visit will provide insight into the existing tanks' condition.
*   A damages occur, aiding the contractor’s understanding of the project requirements and site conditions.
*   Selection criteria will be based on the highest combined rating of technical merit and price.

Bidders may find additional information and documents on the Canadian Government Purchasing Intent website. To participate in this tender, please:
1.  Register for the Government of Canada’s Supplier Registration System and obtain a supplier ID.
